Experience Manager, Data Science Facebook November 2013  – Present (1 year 10 months) Menlo Park Lead analytics teams for 
Instagram (7/2014 - Now) 
Pages, Advertiser growth and SMB (11/2013 - 7/2014) 
 Manager, Global SMB Revenue Insights Google Inc. October 2010  –  November 2013  (3 years 2 months) Mountain View, California I led a team of analysts working on new initiatives and analytics across various channels of marketing CRM. Analysts in my team work collaboratively with marketing and vendor on various HTP programs. We are responsible for both data production as well as analytics associated with HTP. We constantly think creatively on how we can make the program more efficient and advertiser-centric. We analyze big data in search for business insights that can guide us towards our ultimate goal, which is ensurance of advertisers' success. I also co-lead the effort to work cross-functionally with engineering, PM, marketing and external vendor to scale this program. 
 
I am the person who architected the initial infrastructure of HTP from scratch. Since the initiation of this program, I have gone through several rounds of data table and pipeline redesigns. With this effort, we have piloted to hit a milestone of $300M+/year incremental revenue impact. 
 
I am the primary POC from SMB Sales side to work with GDP team in the effort to develop an end-to-end and self-adaptive platform for advertiser interaction. 
 
Designed and implemented advertiser signal repository collecting thousands of signals for all active advertisers, which allows multiple teams to execute signal-based campaigns, conduct cross-channel advertiser and revenue analytics, and generate market overview with visibility from sales executives. 
 
Developed a newbie advertiser potential assessment model, piloted and fully deployed to all markets with AdWords Newbie Sales program. This model increases proactive call rate by 60-100%, has incremental revenue coverage of 40-70%, raises retention rate by 20-30%. Total impact is evaluated at $30M+/year in terms of incremental revenue. 
 
Developed an account assignment model for Google tele-sale vendor use. Piloted in field with an annual impact of $36M+ incremental revenue. Quantitative Marketing Manager Google Inc. January 2009  –  October 2010  (1 year 10 months) Mountain View, California Tech lead of client analyst team 
Built out infrastructure and led analytical efforts which provide market insights to various groups at Google in the process of multiple key business decisions. 
 
Introduced group-based retention view on Google clients 
It replaces the ad-hoc metrics to be the standard way of looking at product retention. Been responsible for client forecasting, evaluation, market opportunity/risk assessment, as well as user and feature research. 
 
Owned 7 dashboards 
Owned 7 dashboards that executives, PMs, researchers refer frequently, and been considered the go-to person for a wide spectrum of market insights related to Google consumer apps. Quantitative Analyst Google Inc. July 2006  –  January 2009  (2 years 7 months) Mountain View, California Modeled Google client valuation 
Developed statistical model that has been accepted by distribution team as the basis for deal evaluation, approved by L&S. 
 
Modeled IE upgrate impact on Google 
Modeled IE7/IE8 impact on Google’s business and efficiently supported client team, L&S with data need. Provided a complex analysis of clickers which refutes DOJ concerns on Yahoo-Google deal. Evaluated impact of Microsoft-Yahoo search partnership. Evaluated the impact and closely monitored Microsoft's browser choice process required by EU. 
 
Competitive defender 
Called out several aggressive slams by competitors, which allows Google to react in time, stop erosion in share, as well as regain the loss. Active and efficient communication with strategic planning. 
 
Initiated growth trend report 
Initiated and collaborated on a report identifying trends in internet user behavior. This report continues to get significant accolades across the company and within the Google board of directors. Summary Dr. Taylan Yildiz is the leading expert in display and cross-media advertising impact measurement and optimization with a focus on Fortune 500 companies. At Google, he has built novel measurement methodologies and managed a team of PhD level statisticians that build such tools. 
 
Currently, he is leading executive level meetings with top global advertisers to build custom and scalable research solutions on media planning, measurement and customer insights. 
 
He also is responsible for approve all global 3rd-party advertising research studies paid for by Google. When needed he partners with these companies to better their methodologies. 
 
He is the founder of the industry-leading products DFA Experiments and DFA Brand Insights which have enabled many of the Doubleclick's Fortune 500 advertisers to measure display campaign impact starting from awareness down to site visits and sales. These tools help advertisers precisely measure their return on advertising investment and get actionable insights on how to maximize this ROI. They also help to evaluate the effectiveness of new display advertising technologies such as remarketing, Doubleclick AdExchange, Rich Media and YouTube Ads. Taylan also manages Google Active GRP, where he holds a patent on the methodology.  
 
He also speaks on effectiveness measurement extensively at statistical as well as industry conferences. Taylan recently delivered the closing keynote address ESOMAR Asia Pacific conference in Singapore. 
 
He also gives regular guest lectures to MBA Students at Stanford Business School. He recently wrote a case study at Stanford on how display advertising can be measured through experimentation, which was also taught at Chicago Booth School of Business. This case helps the new generation of companies demand the right set of effectiveness metrics from the industry.
